38516033.review:
This game is super, super fun though I haven't had it for very long. Satisfying combat, good visuals, difficulty is just right, at least so far as I've seen. The soundtrack is awesome too. I'll update the further into the game I get. 

The ONE gripe I'd have to have is that the cursor is SO hard to keep track of. Locking it to the screen is helpful, but it blends in to most of the scenery too easily. Maybe make it larger, or a brighter color or something. Considering aiming in the right direction is a pretty large need for good gameplay, the cursor needs to be a bit more obvious. 

100% recommend though. Especially now that it's on sale!

36992467.review:
Dieses Spiel kann ich nur empfehlen. Der Soundtrack ist vielleicht nicht jedermanns Sache, aber er passt gut zum Gesamtbild. Die Game-Engine ist das Steckenpferd dieses Indie-Titels: Jede Explosion, jeder Killl belohnt einen mit einzigartigen Partikeleffekten.
Aber ich muss noch etwas hinzufügen, dieses Spiel verlangt euren PCs extrem viel Rechenleistung ab, dies ist für Einige mit Gaming-PCs wahrscheinlich unwichtig, aber ich hab es mir geholt, bevor ich einen hatte, und habe die Erfahrung überhaupt nicht genießen können.

28677335.review:
これを書いている時点でまだ小一時間しかプレイしていないが、これが今後の見降ろし型全方位シューティングの定番になるのではないかとわりと本気で思うくらいには気に入った。
チープなのにリッチというわけのわからないビジュアル、一瞬で理解できる奇をてらわないシステム、繰り返しプレイが楽しくなるスキルが解放できるレベルシステム。
とりあえずたくさん撃ってたくさん殺して物量に負けて「あー楽しかった」ができればいいだけの全方位シューにおいて必要なものはすべて揃っている。
まさに定番たりえるだけのポテンシャルがあると思う。

特筆すべきはそのビジュアルで、ボクセルのチープな見た目に反して信じられないくらいの物理演算が行われ、地形を含むあらゆる物が粉々に砕ける様は一見の価値あり。
しかもちゃっかりオブジェクトによって硬さや崩れ方が違うのも凄まじい。
戦闘が進むにつれどんどんと地面がでこぼこになっていき、射線が地面で塞がれたりアイテムが取りづらくなったりするので必然的に常に移動を続けることになり、クリア時のステージは他では見られないほどの破壊の跡が広がる。

ただまあ、粗がないかといえば全然そんなことはない。
破壊したオブジェクトが崩れずに空中で浮いていることが多々あったり、高解像度だとUIが小さくて見づらかったり、このジャンルの宿命だとは思うがランカーでもなければ飽きが早かったり、まだまだ発展途上な感は否めない。
正式発売にたどり着けるのか、それまでにどれだけ遊びを広げることができるのか、それによって全方位シューの定番と呼べるかどうかが決まる。
期待したい。

28440208.review: Super awesome game. Just run around and destroy everything. The graphics and destruction are super satisfying and the levels are different and interesting, and there are some pretty awesome weapons. However, if you look at this game's minimalistic graphics and thing "Oh, my toaster of a computer can handle this." then be warned that this is more taxing on your pc than it might look. I tried playing this on this decent laptop that I had, but I had to turn the graphics all the way down. Even then it still ran at about 15 fps on some levels, and at that point it just wasn't enjoyable. Still, the gameplay is amazing and the music is equally amazing. Definitely recommended.

La verdad es que el juegov es bastante bueno, le doy un 7/10, porqué no un 10? por el simple hecho de no poder jugar de forma cooperativa con tus amigos, el juego es bastante bueno, se nota de lejos que es claramente un early acces, pero ojalá se le pudiera meter un modo cooperativo en survival, el juego se vuelve repetitivo para algunas personas princialmente por eso, no pueden jugar con sus amigos, y me parece bastante raro que no hayan implementado el modo cooperativo si en las fotos del juego en su página oficial, aparecía una imagen con varios personajes en el mismo mapa, osea que habían mas personas en el mismo server, pero no sé, al fon y al cabo el juego es bastante bueno, lo recomiendo totalmente, es el típico juego que jugás cuando no tenés nada que hacer, o se te vá la conexión, y cosas así.
Ojalá este mensaje llegue a Devoga, y que se den cuenta de que el juego se va a volver repetitivo y aburrido si no implementan un modo cooperativo. 
Y también le doy 7 porque el control está pésimamente optimizado para usar, yo solo uso teclado, pero debe haber gente que le gusta mas la idea de usar un control.
Gracias.

25384106.review: Milé děti... To vám jednou Crimsonland potkal na mejdanu Lego stavebnici, padli si do oka, něco se popilo a ráno zdrhá Crimsonland po špičkách z hotelového pokoje milé stavebnice se svršky v hrsti... A tohle je výsledek té divoké noci... Hordy nepřátel se na vás hrnou ze všech stran a zasažení zmetci se poslušně rozsypávají na kostičky, krev prasí podlahu, sem tam nějaké to vylepšeníčko, levelování postavy, perky, zbraně... Každý si něco najde. Když si vezmu, že to je ještě v předběžném přístupu, čili je potenciál k vylepšení, dotažení, jsem hrubě natěšen, co nás ještě čeká! Nicméně abych jen nejásal - občas se seknete za zbytek sloupku, co z něj zbývá pár kostek, občas v tom chaosu ztratíte zaměřovač a občas prostě vytečete kvůli nějaký jiný kravině. Seknete s myší, flusnete na monitor, probodnete osikovým kůlem klávesnici... Ale za hodinku už to stejně zkoušíte znova :)

25376538.review:
This feels like a spiritual successor to Crimsonland. Very much in the same vein - twin-stick (or mouse-and-keyboard - my preference) shooter, with a top-down, 3D-ish view of unrelenting voxel destruction. The gameplay is manic, excessive, and satisfying. Powerups galore (including some which combine beautifully - as others have mentioned, slow-mo plus gatling gun is the pinnacle of both entertaining gameplay and sound design). 

Like Crimsonland, I think it's fair to say you'll find yourself relying on luck on occasion, which can be frustrating - but for the most part, I found that if I was frequently getting killed, a change in tactics was all that was needed. 

Very polished game for being in Alpha. Definitely worth the price ($6 as of this writing).

24784237.review:
Critical Annihilation - это куча разнообразного оружия, полная разрушаемость и разлетаемость на куски всего вокруг, постоянные взрывы, оставляющие после себя глубокие воронки, толпы разнообразных врагов, полубоссов и боссов, сносящихся пулями, лазерными лучами, мега-вспышками, бомбами, ракетами, авиа-бомбардировками (да, разработчики помешанны на пушках и разрушении), разнообразные локации, пауэр-апы, прокачка статов, пассивные и активные навыки. И конечно слоу-мо.

Отличный саундтрек, приятный визуальный стиль и качественные эффекты освещения.

Из недостатков - как и со многими воксельными играми придется выкрутить настройки на минимум, если у вас не самый современный комп.

На подходе редактор персонажей, уровней, ачивки, больше мозговыносных способностей, оружий, врагов, гигантских боссов, а главое - онлайн кооп.

24605941.review:
Great concept. Very well executed. Blasting enemies and structures is very satisfying!

Currently, however, the game is a little too simple: You fight on very limited area delimited by "laser fences". Enemies keep coming at you until you eliminate all of them then you start again on a slightly difference level. Extremely repetitive... and very hardcore! Some enemies can pretty much one hit kill you and, when you die, you have to start from the beginning of the level. There is some sort of "leveling" system with skill/talent/perk points that you can distribute to improve your character but the process is slow, very slow.

So, if they add more content, new game mode with objective perhaps and larger maps, this might become a very good game. I rate it 5 on 10 for now.

For the price though, you get maybe 10 hours of gaming time until you realize that this is it: You have seen it all.

23369914.review:
[b] Disclaimer - I have been gifted a free key for this game for review purposes, however my review will be kept as truthful as possible, since I am meant to help developers and buyers/gamers.  [/b] 

[b] Critical Annihilation review [/b]

[b] Overview [/b]
Critical Annihilation is a Twin-Stick Shoot-em Up voxel game in which almost every pixel can be blown up in a sense, Published and Developed, into early access Feb 12, 2016 by Devoga.

[b] Graphics [/b]
For a pixel game not only does it have decent graphics, they have also been optimised so everyone no matter the pc can run them, they will no doubt be improved in the future with no cost of player loosing fps.

[b] Music/Options/Menu [/b]
The music was fantastic, the options, simple to the point easy to navigate and understand, the menu was fancy looking and great for an early access game.

[b] Pros and Cons [/b]
Pros:
Potential Potential Potential!!!
Fun time waster
A great survival game in the future if the devs do it right
Great physics

Cons:
No story for the events taking place
No backstory for the character's
No knowledge of what type of aliens you are fighting, and their motives

A good game with a large fanbase as well as future, I give it a 8.0/10

[h1] I have been gifted the key by the kind developers of the game. They make my review about games like this possible.[/h1]

[i] If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [/i]  [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/GameRelatedUniverse] The Group [/url]

23311798.review: 1 of the most casual adicting games I ever played this last years have too much potential and gameplay 10/10 and graphics.... when you saw cube things you can think it's minecraft or something like that but.... it's 1 of the best visual games you can see ever really nice gem game for only 10 euros

23284506.review:
This game is up there with my favorite. I can't think of a better way to describe it than in a pro's and con's list, So i'll keep it short and simple.


Pros
- Absolutly beautiful graphics, There is something about voxel based graphics that makes me fall in love with a game.

- Everything is destructable, With everything bieng made of small bricks, it creates a great enviornment for blowing things up and shooting every thing. There is nothing more satisfying than finishing a level and seeing the large craters in the ground accompanied with half a building.

- Plenty of stuff to do, There are tons of levels to play, plenty of weapons to fight with, and plenty of enemies to fight, giving you enough explosions to last a lifetime.

- Very customizable, When you enter the options menu, there is a large assortment of settings to change, for graphics, audio, and key bindings. If you don't have the best computer, you can still play this game with sustainable FPS.

- BOOM BANG POW BUZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ BOOM EXPLOSIONS


Cons

-Needs a little balancing on certain levels

- Nope can't think of anthing else

- BOOM EXPLOSIONS

22789993.review:
ほぼ最高設定の画質にすると、過去に例が無い位、美しいです。一見の価値あり。
グラフィックが、贅沢にきれいなだけで、ゲーム内容は、カジュアルゲームや携帯ゲームによくあるタイプのレベル上げてステージクリアしていく単調気味なゲームシステムっぽい。ですが、中毒性は非常に高いと思います。（私はこの手のは、結構好きなので・・・）

ゲームコントローラーが使える仕様とのことで、購入したが、xbox360ゲーコンだけでは、メニュー操作ができず、ちょっと使いずらい。
まだEAなので、正式リリース時に改善されてくれるとうれしい。

マウスだと、照準クロスで狙えるので、思い通り撃てるが、コントローラーだと、方向だけでしか狙えないので、空爆などピンポイント範囲攻撃の大火力武器が使いずらい。

画面構成は、斜め見下ろし型のディアブロやトーチライトみたいなハクスラRPGですが、
地形がマインクラフトのブロックをもっと細かくした感じで、実際、マップ上の構造物のほとんどが、銃で削れたり、
爆破で建物、障壁、地面に大きく穴が空くところが少し楽しい。地形が変化するのは、新鮮。

構造物を破壊できるという意味では、壁に穴を空けてバンカーっぽく利用することもできる。
（敵が四方八方から大量に沸くので、現状のマップでは、そういった細かい戦略を使うような利用価値は意味ないけど）

各ステージは、アリーナ形式で、せまいといえばせまい。

ゲームシステムは、iOS、Androidゲームにあるような、
「Earn to Die」、「Zombie Ville」シリーズ、「Dead Ahead」「Swamp Attack」みたいなノリ。
これらのゲームの持つ中毒性に近い。好きな人なら、はまると思う。

構造物のほぼすべてを細かめのブロック単位の破壊ができるので、今後に期待。

今月中にゲームモードにディフェンスモードが追加され、Waveの合間にディフェンス構造物のビルドができるとか。ブロックゲーらしさを楽しめそう。期待できそうですね。

敵を倒した後に永久に地面に残る血痕表現をレインボーカラーに設定で変更でき、まるでスプラトゥーンのようにカラフルなる（笑）

22063827.review:
Critical Annihilation is a fantastic voxel based shoot em up game that puts you in the role of the last human alive on the planet, your mission not just to survive but to annihilate all invading aliens and drive them out of the solar systems one planet at a time. The game mixes RPG aspect such as the leveling systems that unlocks further abilities you may use innately and those that you must call forth at the right time, such as an ac-130 gun ship to rain fire down upon your enemy or a sentry tower to provide cover fire for your well planned escape. You will also gain ability points to spend in such skills as speed, health regeneration, and a number of others that will give you the upper hand you may need in order to succeed as the levels grow harder and harder with every victory. This extremely fast pace game will get your heart racing as you jump and fire in all directions as chaos consumes the screen in a bright and vibrant display of both color and carnage. 

Pros:

- Great level design even if at first they seem simple, given the ability to damage the surrounding areas with your weapons allows for an ever changing play through.
-Leveling system is well balanced giving you just enough to allow you an edge without making you to overpower to soon.
-The three difficulties is just right for both beginner and expect alike allowing you to tailor your own experience.
-Replay value is definitely there as you can go back to try your hand at a high score everyone can see or simply go back to get more experience to level up and try and beat that pesky level giving you a hard time. 
-Music is amazing and only further adds to the immersion effect 

Cons: 

-The game is rather short at the moment but given time I have no doubt they will be adding more levels to the game (side note: even though there aren’t a great deal of levels to play, depending on your skill this still may take you a good amount of hours to beat)

In conclusion, a great game definitely worth the price and will only get better as time goes on, I for one can’t wait to see what lies ahead for this game and this company.5 out of 5, one of the best voxel based shoot em up games I’ve played in years. The Winner of the Dragon Games Award. 
                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                     AC-Gamer

21912425.review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title: Critical Annihilation
Genre: Action, Indie, Early Access
Developer: Devoga 
Publisher: Devoga	
Release Date: 12 Feb, 2016[/b]

[h1]Basic Overview[/h1]
Critical Annihilation is a Shoot 'Em Up game, which focuses mainly on killing enemies and destorying the environment around you. The game itself is really well presented and polished up for the current state that it's in (Early Access), the art style of the game is really niceand the current amount of weapons is decent for the time being. It's very addicting to play and is insanely fun. It is worth noting that this game does demand for your computer to be decent, especially when it comes to destorying the enviroment with all of the explosions happening and big craters that are on the ground. If you are having troubles with performance issues of this game, then I suggest you do some changes in the opitions menu to make the game run smoothly.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Critical Annihilation is a fast paced shoot 'em up with some really cool perks, and character progression. The game is strangely addiciting along with all of the enemies that you have to kill. The destructable enviroment of the game really fits well with all of the enemies that will be running at you trying to kill you. Although, when playing through the game, it seems that the game is really demanding for your computer to be decent. With all of the explosions happening when you pla through the game and craters that appear on the ground, make sure your specs of your computer are good enough to run this game decently. There is a rather large selection of weapons available up for use to kill your enemies with. Providing that there is also randomly generated drop system in this current stage of the game, it is really impressive to see that sort of detail be in the game already at this stage of the game that is currently in Early Access.

[h1]Art Style[/h1]
The decent visuals and art style of this game really fit the type of game the developers made for this game. Most of the stages are very well detailed, with vibrant lighting and colours which really bring this game to life. The games graphics are made out of voxels, but upon doing some research of this game, it was also based upon the voxel engine which allows for the destructable enviroments that happen during the game. The lighting really comes into play when explosions happen throughout, the lighting is really well presented when exlpsions occur and that's when the lighting effect is best shown off. 

[h1]Music & Sound[/h1]
Generically, the sounds are very nicely done and presented when playing through the game. With the music in the background that really fits the fast paced shooter game, with a kind of dubstep music to it. The sounds of the guns and the enemies are fairly nice, not annoying like some game where they use the same sound effects for each gun.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
A very fun and addictive game to play, with some really nice graphics and explosions that occur through the game. Although it demands a bit on your PC, so make sure that your specs or up with the recommened specs. If you are having trouble then tweek some settings to make the game run smooth. Some really nice music to fit the fast paced type of game.

21880477.review:
[b]Critical Annihilation[/b] is an isometric twin-stick shooter with a voxel graphic style. Not only the graphics are made out of voxels, but the game itself is based upon a voxel engine, thus allowing for destructible environments and some pretty good looking particle and lighting effects when there is an explosion. It is also worth noting that the can be somewhat demanding on your computer, especially during big explosions due to all the particles flying and the big craters that appear on the ground. That said, the game already has a very detailed options menu so if you run into trouble running the game, you can do some tweaking and it will most likely run fine.

One thing I must say is that I’m not really one to play much of these top down survival shooters. Still, I was atracted by its rather unique look and was surprised that I found myself enjoying the gameplay as much as I did.

One other thing that surprised me was the soundtrack. I’m not much of a listener to this type of electronic music (dubstep?) but I must say that after playing the game for a few hours, it started feeling quite catchy and it kind of grew on me.

[h1]The core:[/h1]
By looking at the game trailer and screenshots you can clearly guess what the game is all about, mowing down hordes of enemies. That said, I’m going to try to explain some other mechanics that the game has.

First and foremost, you have three different modes, one of which is not available at the moment. You have your campaign mode, that currently has 15 different missions, which allows you to unlock powerups, perks, weapons and the specific mission maps for survival mode. Survival mode, as you probably imagined, is just survive as long as you can. Last but by no means least, “classic survival” mode, which is unavailable at the moment, is basically survival mode but with no powerups and you select your weapon at the beginning, atleast according to its description. As with any other game of this genre, Critical Annihilation also features online highscore leaderboards.

Now, where the game gets interesting, atleast for me, is with the ability to choose different characters and improve them, unlock perks and different abilities. As of right now, you can choose between three different classes, Soldier, Engineer and Scout. Each one of them has their own ups and downs and you should try each one of them out and see which one better suits your playstyle. That said, the character progression is fast paced, every now and then you’ll be able to spend points to upgrade your stats (Life, Accuracy, Speed, Stamina, Regeneration and Shield). You’ll also be able to choose different perks and abilities for your current character.

Perks are basically passive abilities, such as increased life regeneration and the ability to make enemy bullets move slower. Abilities on the other hand are divided into two categories, offensive and defensive abilities. While playing you can activate your offensive ability with “Q” and your defensive ability with “E”. Examples of offensive abilities are things such as a sentry turret or an airstrike, while defensive abilties can be something like a plasma shield that makes you invulnerable for a short period of time or the ability to slow down time.

After killing them, some enemies will drop either weapons or powerups. Weapons range from your standard assault rifle, shotgun, laser pulse rifle, grenade launcher and minigun. The minigun particularly is really satisfying to use, since it completely obliterates waves of enemies. Powerups can be simple things such as medkits or life saving items such as nukes, turrets and rocket launchers. The nukes are my favourite because they cause a huge explosion and leave a hole on the ground.

One thing I also found out to be really helpful was the ability to jump, which is rather unusal for a game like this. Jumping allows you to shoot rockets above the enemies at the front so that the explosion hits the middle of a crowd, thus causing more casualties. 


[h1]Verdict:[/h1]

To sum things up, I do have some minor things that I think need to be adressed. One is the fact that the game has no story whatsoever. This is not necessarily a bad thing for some people, especially people who are die hard fans of this genre, but others like myself might find this to be a negative point.

One other very slight complaint that I have is the fact that the the sprinting animation is very hard to distinguish from the standard move animation. I believe that having a different animation for sprinting would allow new players to distinguish the two a little bit better. Maybe I’m just nitpicking.

Still, after looking at the forums, I can say that the developer is open and takes into consideration the ideas and suggestions given by the players and the community, so it wouldn’t surprise me if these small issues I have with the game would be adressed.

In the end, the game is pretty simple, and people looking for an in-depth shooter might not find that here. That said, this game is ideal for people who just want to have some mindless fun and have the satisfaction of shooting endless hordes of enemies in the face and, as I mentioned, the game has its fair share of perks, weapons and power ups, so if you’re into that sort of thing, I think you’ll find plenty of enjoyment here.

21863894.review:
Nothing I enjoy more than having a nice relaxing evening playing a mindless twin stick shooter, plowing through waves of creatures, and building up that old school high score..  (brought back memories of my days plugging quarters into the arcade, trying to beat some over the top high score.)  When I first saw Critical Annihilation my first thought was this looks awesome..  After playing the game for a few hours I said yes, this game is awesome.  Voxel based games have really taken off the last few years...  While some may take issue with the art style and game play, I love it.  

[b]Gameplay -[/b]  

Typical twin stick shooter game play, (pretty sure they are still considered twin stick on the PC, anyway) the environment is billed as being totally destructible, which is great, but on almost all the levels you'll be too busy avoiding bullets, zombies, spiders and everything else the game throws at you... In all that mayhem, you'll likely forget all about the Environment being destructible.   From what I saw stuff got destroyed after a while, but this isn't a game about causing massive destruction, but about killing lots of enemies.  What sets Critical Annihilation apart from the other twin stickers out there....  along with the above-mentioned environment destruction, the game has some rpg elements as well, with various stats you can increase as you level up.  The game appears to have 3 classes which are unique from each other, Soldier, Engineer and Scout, each class has their own advantages and disadvantages..  The Soldier has the best base combat stats, but no regen or shields..   The Engineer has ok combat stats but starts with a high shield, the Scout has the weakest combat stats but starts off with high regen.

The stages are fairly large (they are contained to a large round play space), nice amount of room to kite them around (kiting is the act of running around in large circles while the enemies lump together allowing you to pick them off one by one) very common tactic in twin shooters.  Although you can employ the kiting tactic to get an advantage, it starts being far less effective the higher in levels you get.  The last stage I played had I could have sworn 50 - 60 enemies on it.  The difficult really ramps up, with each stage you finish. 
 
CA has 2 main game modes, Campaign, and Survival..   Campaign's and the survival modes are the same, with the major difference being, the campaign will eventually have you wiping out the enemies and facing a boss battle prior to moving onto the next area.   While survival is as you may have guessed trying to stay alive for as long as humanly possible... (After about 3 minutes or so survival seems to get very very hairy, and dare I say very fun.).  A third game mode is grayed out, being an early access title I'll make the leap this mode is currently being worked on, or I didn't finish the game far enough along to unlock it.  

[b]pro's[/b]
Fun and addictive game play
Decent music, 
very challenging,
high intensity

[b]con's[/b]
some minor glitches with enemies
occasional hit detection failures

[Summation]
I'd recommend this fun title, have yourself some mindless fun, slaying all manners of creatures, level up your characters, chew bubblegum and kick butts.  Just remember when you fail (which you will) dust yourself off and try again.  Just remember, winners never quit!!!

21510517.review:
[h1]"Critical Annihilation is a Top-Down shooter game about killing aliens and destruction."[/h1]

[b][u]Keep in mind that the game is still in Early Access,so don't expect a lot from it.[/u][/b]

First of all this game is amazing and addictive,the really good beat music in the background really adds to it,it's a good time killer and the voxel technology makes this experience 10x better.The whole environment around you is destroyable. Your goal in this one is to kill all the enemies in every stage and score the most points.

The game features a Stats option,by leveling up your character from killing aliens you gain point that you can than use to upgrade your character,increase his health,speed,armor,stength,and many more.You also unlock various perks that can help you trough the game.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]

- Really good soundtracks (dubstep,electronic)
- Character selection
- Character upgrade system
- Decent visuals
- Nice artstyle
- Greatly detailed stages,good lighting and colors
- Voxel technology that makes everything destructible and adds a lot of particles
- Decent number of weapon types
- Decent number of enemies
- Random drop system (xp multiplier,shied,weapons,and more)

[h1]CONS:[/h1]

- Game can be a bit too hard as the levels go on
- You need a pretty decent PC to run it,because the particle effects are demanding
- Some enemies are going trough the walls in some stages

   (If i find any more downsides or anything to the game i'll update my review)

[b]P.S.[/b] The game has an early tech demo version over at Gamejolt if you want to try it out before buying it,it doesn't have a lot of the features that the full version has,but it's worth a try.

[b][u]Conclusion:[/u][/b]
The game is really fun,you can enjoy trying to beat your or other people's highscore,or just have fun destroying stuff,it's completely up to you.The game needs some tweaks here and there,but for the moment it's pretty good in my opinion.
If you are looking for a game with some good music in the background,and where you kill lots of enemies while the nice environment around you is slowly fading away from all that destrucion,than it's a game for you. :)
If you are deciding to buy it,have fun and game on. :D

[b]Final Score: 9/10[/b]

21363914.review:
This video features a non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khekEyS6VR8

Do you like Twin-sticks? Do you like lots of gore and particle explosions? Look no further. Critical Annihilation is a Twin-Stick SHMUP (Shoot-em Up) made entirely out of tiny voxels. We take advantage of voxel technology to hype up the explosive gameplay. Everything is destructible to its core. As your home planet gets invaded by aliens you decide to take up arms with the rest of the planet and annihilate every single alien in site. As you progress in the game you'll bring yourself to whole new planets like the Moon and Mars until you've reached the aliens Mothership. Why exactly are these cliche aliens attacking your cliche planet in the good old fashion cliche way? It's for you to find out as you destroy every cube of their being. This is the same game played by popular youtubers Markiplier and JackSepticEye; Critical Mass. Now with updated art and updated code to bring you a more full, and action packed experience. - highly Recommended!

21241348.review: it is very fun and i still have yet to get bored of any aspect of the game. The only thing i think the game should add is a co-op game mode

21240531.review:
Very beautiful grafik and physiks, its challenging and has great music. I highly recommend it.

However there are some suggestions and tips how this game could get better. (Since its still early access and I just had some ideas, maybe theyre stupid, but hey you can just ignore them.)

Ideas: 

1. I haven't completed the campain yet but I already wish there would be more levels. Maybe some more stages and/or Bosslevels after a Chapter.

2. More characters. I dont now if you have to unlock some first but it would be cool if there were more options depending how you think you could survive best.

3. A co - op mode would be very nice. Dont now if local is needed, but online has to be a thing.

Bugs?:

1. Dont know if that is intented but some monsters just clip through the environment. And I checked, no, the obstacles were completly intact.

2. When an enemie ( for example a dog) stands right infront of me, the bullets spawn behind him and do no damage, which is annoying when you are not fast enough to back off.

3. Balance: The diffuculty is nice and balanced. The only thing bothering me are the special enemies with special guns, which make so much damage if you dont look out. Most of them are big enought to see, but some look very similar to the "normal" guys and get overlooked so easy. And the red bar doesnt realy help. Maybe make the similar looking ones just bigger or shinier? Would be very helpfull. EDIT: As some other reviewers say, I also think the cross to aim should be better to see.

PS: I dont speak english, so sorry if the grammar is bad^^
